content: A British physicist, born in the 1940s, known for his groundbreaking work in black holes and cosmology. His name is "Stephen" what?

Stephen Hawking. He was a renowned theoretical physicist and cosmologist who made significant contributions to our understanding of the universe, particularly in the areas of black holes and the origins of the cosmos. Hawking was born on January 8, 1942, in Oxford, England, and passed away on March 14, 2018. He was known not only for his scientific achievements but also for his popular science books, including "A Brief History of Time," which made complex concepts accessible to a broad audience.
